subject: After the Emmys
event:
For those of you who may have been hiding under a rock since Sunday... or maybe watching the Falcons/ Eagles game when you should have been wtching the Emmycast... the big news here is that Peter Dinklage won the Emmy for Best Supporting Actor for this portrayal of Tyrion Lannister in HBO's GAME OF THRONES.

Goes without saying (but I'll say it anyway) that all of us from GOT were thrilled by Peter's win.  Much deserved.  And only the first of many, I suspect.

GAME lost out in the other three ctegories where we had nominations, alas... including BEst Drmaatic Series, where MAD MEN took home the Emmy for the fourth straight year.  But as the beloved Brooklyn Dodgers of my youth used to say, "Wait'll Next Year."

The Emmy festivities have changed immensely since the last time I ws up for one (for BEAUTY AND THE BEAST, back in 1989 or so).  The weekend was a blur of pre-parties, post-parties, receptions, gifting lounges, red carpets, and limos.  Parris and I got to lift a glass or three with Peter, David & Dan and their lovely wives, Mark Addy, Lena Headey, Michelle Fairley, Kit Harrington, Jason Momoa, and Nicholaj Coster-Waldau, and some of the cast from BOARDWALK EMPIRE as well.  I met lots of very cool people, and was astonished and delighted by how many fans the series -- both the TV series AND the books -- has in Hollywood, even on other networks and series.  (Keep a sharp eye out in future weeks for GOT nods on a couple of your favorite comedies).

But now to work.  I'm still in LA, and will be here for the rest of the week, but from this point on it's mostly meetings.  But more good stuff may come out of those as well... one hopes...

comments.article:
Definitely deserved for Peter, but AGOT was robbed by Mad Men. The Mad Men 4th season wasn't the best... a new champ was warranted.

Curious as to which comedies will be tipping their hats! Also, please stop by in Ottawa, Canada, George! It's a lovely city, and we take care of our guests.
comments.subject: Giant of Lannister

comments.article:
Yes! I have been recuiting Ottawa fans to your cause for several years now & it's really starting to spread - we'd all love it if you were to stop by our little town sometime for a visit... For your sake though, I'd not suggest during winter, which is coming.

As for comedies that might throw in GoT nods sometime soon, my money is on Big Bang Theory. I believe at least some of them were there at the Emmys, and the characters on the show are definitely genre fans. The show also has a history of slipping in some fandom fodder now and then, such as the several episodes where you can see them playing a fantasy/RPG-themed board game called Talisman.
comments.subject: Re: Giant of Lannister

comments.article:
"(Keep a sharp eye out in future weeks for GOT nods on a couple of your favorite comedies)."

I don't have American TV. Can someone post these shout-outs in the comment section of this blog as they see them?
Thanks!
Вітаю пана Петра, Тіріон +1

I laughed so hard reading this post because of the typos: ctegories, BEst, Drmaatic, ws :D

I am really happy that Peter won, he totally deserved it, and I hope we see other cast members getting their own statues soon.

And the most important thing: HAPPY BIRTHDAY Mr. Martin! :D
Well, if I'd being haven't the past few days Mr Martin's been having, I doubt I could type straight too.....

It'd be nice if a Wild Cards movie came out of those meetings.

Congrats on all the success of Game of Thrones.
My vote is a Wild Cards tv series.

GAME lost out in the other three ctegories where we had nominations, alas... including BEst Drmaatic Series, where MAD MEN took home the Emmy for the fourth straight year. But as the beloved Brooklyn Dodgers of my youth used to say, "Wait'll Next Year."

Unless season 2 is amazing beyond words, Breaking Bad is a lock for Best Drama next year. This season has been amazing beyond words. The latest episode would have passed for a season finale in any other series it was so amazing.
comments.subject: Dunno...

comments.article: Season One of GoT was just the warm-up round.  Believe me.
comments.subject: Re: Dunno...

comments.article: Just wanted to say Happy Birthday! I am pretty pleased that we share the same birthday, so hope good things come for you on this most magical of days.
comments.subject: Happy Birthday!

comments.article:
Mad Men. Yes they were to not choose Game. Well I suppose it's to be expected. It's a "period" and insider show.

But, anyhoo. I'm glad that the missus and you had a swaggarific time. Reap those rewards...

And if you are not too busy, remember to post you take on the Jets and Giants. I'm looking forward to it.

Peter deserved his award so much :') I'm so very glad he won! GoT should have won the other awards it was nominated for as well, but hopefully we'll get what we deserve with the next seasons!

Happy birthday and congratulations for everything, Martin!

Season 2 is going to produce more Emmy nominations, no doubt. And season 3...holy %#&*! Anyone who hasn't read the books, and I know a few of them in my office, are in for some amazing episodes.

One of my friends at work has watched every television series ever produced, I think, so I was a bit nervous when I plugged Game of Thrones during a meeting with my staff before episode 1 had even aired. After watching season 1, though, my friend says it's among the best television he's ever watched. I did, of course, tell him, "You ain't seen nothin' yet."

http://itunes.apple.com/tw/app/fictionstats/id452108717?mt=8
comments.subject: Wait'll season 2, indeed

comments.article:
Most importantly, I want to wish you a Happy Birthday, all the best, good health, love, prosperity and everything else! May you have many more ahead, full of goodness and delight!

As for the Emmys, they might have changed, but their myopia and narrow-mindedness hasn't! When you continuously give the award for best TV series to the same show for 4 years in a row, especially when there are other much better shows out there...that speaks volumes! "Game Of Thrones" should have won hands-down, no questions asked! What about "The Walking Dead", "The Killing", "Boardwalk Empire", if "Game Of Thrones" wasn't it, any of the other shows could have easily won over "Mad Men"...don't even get me started on the acting categories...

I enjoy the show on my own terms, and could care less for the Emmys or any other awards, though I understand it is a nice thing to win and be recognized by your peers...so my comments notwithstanding, congratulations are in order for Mr. Dinklage and Dan & Dan and the rest of the cast and crew who bring the show to life!
comments.subject: Emmys...blaaaaahhhhh....

comments.article: Happy birthday Mr. Martin!
Happy Birthday and congrats on a great year!

Congratulations to Peter.

Can anyone tell me what clip of Peter's performance was shown at The Emmy's? I'm pretty sure it won't have been the confession in the Eerie but I am curious ;)
Thank you in advance.

Dear George, congratulations for your birthday!!! I love your books, all of them (at least all that I've read): I laughed with big bastard Tuf, laughed even more with small bastard Tyrion, and felt my heart struggled with Lya.
All my best wishes for you (and Parris, of course) and I hope to see you next year in Gijón, at the Semana Negra.

PS: and, of course, my congrats to Peter Dinklage for his absolutely deserved award! And for all the team for the nominations! You're doing a great great show.
comments.subject: Congrats!! Happy birthday!!!

comments.article: Personally, while I would have liked a win, I like to think the fact that GoT was nominated as a positive sign that fantasy is more and more becoming "respectable." Remember back in the day, when you couldn't go talking about your favorite fantasy in public or you'd wind up with a head in a trashcan? I certainly do not miss those days.

Well, Happy Birthday George. Here is to many, many more years of writing and keeping us in suspense. Because at the end of it, it is well worth the wait.

Your books are just like a good wine. After every read they get better as wine gets better by every year.

comments.upictitle: Jenna: Sugar and spice and all that
comments.article: I was in LA this weekend too :P You would have fit in there (The HP Lovecraft Film Festival is now in LA as well) It wasn't until Sunday that I realized "Hey! It's the Emmy weekend..."

So happy for Peter. I literally jumped and shouted when he won. :)

I am hoping next year, GOT will win more awards.

And, HAPPY BIRTHDAY, GEORGE!

I'm only 47. The Dodgers left Brooklyn before I was born. But they will ALWAYS be the Brooklyn Dodgers. Sorry LA!

Congratulations, sir!

Happy Birthday!

And congratulations on the Dinklage win. I'm sure more Emmy noms and wins will come in future seasons as GoT takes over the viewing public's consciousness the way the Sopranos did.

First & probably only time to vote 4 an Emmy! ...lol! Way to Go Peter! I can't wait 4 season 2!!!

GoT = my favorite-est series ever!!! I'll be pacing/biting my nails until WoW comes out!...Tyrion is my favorite character in the TV show, I can't wait to see the rendition of Arya's progression! I'll be buying the blue-ray for my parents whenever it comes out (my Mom has never read the books, but I'm hoping to corrupt them - I've already corrupted my hubby) LOL!

Oh well...while waiting for the season 1 release, and season 2 air date, as well as the next book...I suppose I must console myself with reading the Wheel of Time series...:(

GRRM - Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! for sharing your world of GoT with us!!!

~ Long time lurker, first time poster
comments.subject: Tyrion!!!! WOHOO!!!

comments.article:
Happy Birthday George :) Perhaps we should bake a Tairy Goodkind Pie to celebrate?

(I kid. Such a thing would kill whoever ate it.)
congrats to Peter, and hopefully next year the show gets a few more wins.
comments.subject: Happy Birthday George!

comments.article:
I was glad Peter Dinklage won, because he has done some excellent work.

Also, Happy Birthday to you, sir. A couple more days till mine rolls around.
comments.subject: Well deserved win for our Tyrion
